channel.title: Ip adress
channel.description: well in my client i changed the server = ip to the ip im using mollypkz.ddns.net for people to log on and the client is acting like its not finding that ip ive compiled and ran it everything looks ok ports are the same client sided and server sided and i port forwarded through my router tcp anyone have any idea what may be going on?

item.title: Ip adress
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Callisto, post:6, topic:551060”][quote author=boi_jx link=topic=669974.msg4480163#msg4480163 date=1429058680]
figured it out lol i had to set a static ip cause my router wasnt finding my computers ip
in my port forwarding
[/quote]

the whole point of no-ip is so you don’t have to have a static ip, so no…[/quote]
he set his local IP address (The 192.168 one) to a static address. Not his broadcast IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Ip adress
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

Is NO-IP running in the background? Also are you sure you enabled your IP on NO-IP?
